items.title: cssnext
items.description:
Edge CSS syntax made available for browsers now.

http://cssnext.io/

items.title: Flexbox
items.description:
Flexbox is the modern improved way to layout visual elements.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Using_CSS_flexible_boxes

items.title: Web Components
items.description: Web Components allow for modular CSS using import() and the Shadow DOM which solve complex nested selectors that could overwrite each other.

items.title: Less
items.description:
Less adds advanced features to CSS, including a nested CSS syntax, parameters and mixins. Less is a pre-processor, hence needs to be compiled to CSS. 

http://lesscss.org/

items.title: SASS
items.description:
SASS adds advanced features to CSS, including a nested CSS syntax, parameters and mixins. Less is a pre-processor, hence needs to be compiled to CSS. 

http://sass-lang.com/

items.title: Plain
items.description:
Writing plain CSS is almost an anti-pattern for bigger projects because its almost unmaintainable. 

It might be still a good option for a small project that don't want to employ build tools.
